meanings.definition: Relating to changes or developments over time.

meanings.sent3: The diachronic growth of a tree can be observed through its annual rings.
meanings.sent4: Her diachronic approach to fashion design captures the essence of each era.
meanings.sent5: The diachronic changes in technology have revolutionized communication.

meanings.sent2: Researchers use diachronic to track the development of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The diachronic of a river's path can teach us about geological processes.
